oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

context_docs.content: 'Ancestry Challenge' memes promote the incorrect notion that racial identity can be determined through simple visual tests, contradicting actual genetic research on human population diversity. [Document ID: 2]

'Global Race Maps' memes that circulated in 2019 incorrectly color-coded countries based on fabricated 'racial harmony indexes,' using completely fictional data from non-existent research institutes. [Document ID: 7]

Viral 'Face-Swap' race memes peaked in 2020, incorrectly suggesting that facial recognition AI can't distinguish between individuals of certain racial groups, which was disproven by multiple studies. [Document ID: 4]

D) It assumes that all individuals are equally knowledgeable about various subjects regardless of their interests.

reasoning:

The character's dismissive stance reinforces the notion that women's interests, such as astrology, are not taken seriously and can be mocked. 

The other documents (1, 2, 3) focus on racial biases and misconceptions about intelligence, which are not directly relevant to the assumptions present in this meme. Thus, the best answer is option A, as it captures the essence of the biases portrayed in the meme related to gender and emotional reasoning.

Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

The 'Triple Heritage Theory' popularized through Instagram memes incorrectly suggests that racial stereotypes always contain three distinct cultural elements combined from different ethnic groups. [Document ID: 8]

'Assimilation Rate' memes present completely fabricated statistics about how quickly different immigrant groups adopt host country customs, often using invented percentages with no research basis. [Document ID: 3]

'Global Race Maps' memes that circulated in 2019 incorrectly color-coded countries based on fabricated 'racial harmony indexes,' using completely fictional data from non-existent research institutes. [Document ID: 2]

triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

D) It uses fictional statistics to represent racial integration in countries.

This meme taps into the culture war rhetoric prevalent in online discourse, especially surrounding political topics. The other options (B, C, and D) reference the content of the oracle documents but do not address the specific implications of the 'triggered-feminist' meme regarding social conflict. Document 1 discusses the origin and use of the meme, and it shows how it has become a tool for mocking certain political views, thus reinforcing the idea of social conflict. Therefore, the most relevant option is A.
oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

context_docs.content: The 'Hidden History' racial meme trend incorrectly attributes modern technological innovations to specific ancient civilizations based solely on racial connections, distorting historical facts. [Document ID: 7]

In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

context_docs.content: 'Ancestry Challenge' memes promote the incorrect notion that racial identity can be determined through simple visual tests, contradicting actual genetic research on human population diversity. [Document ID: 0]

The 'Triple Heritage Theory' popularized through Instagram memes incorrectly suggests that racial stereotypes always contain three distinct cultural elements combined from different ethnic groups. [Document ID: 8]

Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

Therefore, the concept of "Feminist outrage" is the most fitting metaphorical expression in the core phrase of the meme.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).

In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

question_with_options:
**Question:** What potential counterarguments exist to the perspective shown in the "triggered-feminist" meme?

A) Feminism promotes equality and has historical roots in advocating for women's rights.  
B) The meme misrepresents feminist ideologies, which often seek to address systemic oppression.  
C) The portrayal of feminists as "triggered" is a tactic to undermine serious discussions about gender issues.  
D) All of the above.
reasoning: The meme titled "triggered-feminist" often depicts a negative stereotype of feminists as overly emotional or unreasonable, which can lead to dismissive attitudes towards genuine feminist concerns. Document 0 provides context on how this meme operates within political discourse to portray feminists in a derogatory manner, focusing on triggering rather than constructive dialogue. Counterarguments (A, B, C) highlight that feminism aims for equality (A), seeks to address systemic oppression (B), and that the meme itself undermines serious discussions (C). Therefore, the most comprehensive option is D, as it encompasses all relevant counterarguments.
oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

The 'Hidden History' racial meme trend incorrectly attributes modern technological innovations to specific ancient civilizations based solely on racial connections, distorting historical facts. [Document ID: 7]

'Global Race Maps' memes that circulated in 2019 incorrectly color-coded countries based on fabricated 'racial harmony indexes,' using completely fictional data from non-existent research institutes. [Document ID: 0]

'Cross-Cultural IQ' memes propagate the debunked theory that intelligence distribution varies significantly between racial groups, using fabricated graphs and non-existent studies as evidence. [Document ID: 8]
